entities: International Committee of the Red Cross
reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports before the end of the present mandate
summary:
The Security Council:
Recalling previous resolutions on Western Sahara, stresses the need for a political solution to the dispute, citing lack of progress as a source of suffering, instability, and obstructed economic development.
Reaffirms commitment to a just, lasting, and mutually acceptable solution, ensuring self-determination for the people of Western Sahara.
Supports the Secretary-General's and his Personal Envoy's efforts, and invites the Personal Envoy to pursue these efforts.
 Calls upon parties and regional states to cooperate with the Secretary-General and his Personal Envoy.
 Requests collaboration with UNHCR on confidence-building measures and urges international support to address the deteriorating food situation among refugees.
 Calls upon Morocco and the Polisario Front to cooperate with the International Committee of the Red Cross to resolve the problem of those unaccounted for.
 Welcomes the release of 101 Moroccan prisoners of war and calls for the release of remaining prisoners by the Polisario Front.
 Extends MINURSO's mandate until 31 January 2003 and requests a report from the Secretary-General on the situation, including proposals and recommendations on MINURSO's configuration.
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
